segment.source: Microsoft network server Amount of idle time required before suspending session (Windows 10)
segment.target: Microsoft network server Amount of idle time required before suspending session (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Microsoft network server Amount of idle time required before suspending session security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Microsoft network server Amount of idle time required before suspending session security policy setting.

segment.source: Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session
segment.target: Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session security policy setting.

segment.source: Each Server Message Block (SMB) session consumes server resources.
segment.target: Each Server Message Block (SMB) session consumes server resources.

segment.source: Establishing numerous null sessions will cause the server to slow down or possibly fail.
segment.target: Establishing numerous null sessions will cause the server to slow down or possibly fail.

segment.source: A malicious user might repeatedly establish SMB sessions until the server stops responding; at this point, SMB services will become slow or unresponsive.
segment.target: A malicious user might repeatedly establish SMB sessions until the server stops responding; at this point, SMB services will become slow or unresponsive.

segment.source: The Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session policy setting determines the amount of continuous idle time that must pass in an SMB session before the session is suspended due to inactivity.
segment.target: The Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session policy setting determines the amount of continuous idle time that must pass in an SMB session before the session is suspended due to inactivity.

segment.source: You can use this policy setting to control when a device suspends an inactive SMB session.
segment.target: You can use this policy setting to control when a device suspends an inactive SMB session.

segment.source: The session is automatically reestablished when client device activity resumes.
segment.target: The session is automatically reestablished when client device activity resumes.

segment.source: A user-defined number of minutes from 0 through 99,999
segment.target: A user-defined number of minutes from 0 through 99,999

segment.source: For this policy setting, a value of 0 means to disconnect an idle session as quickly as is reasonably possible.
segment.target: For this policy setting, a value of 0 means to disconnect an idle session as quickly as is reasonably possible.

segment.source: The maximum value is 99999, which is 208 days.
segment.target: The maximum value is 99999, which is 208 days.

segment.source: In effect, this value disables the policy.
segment.target: In effect, this value disables the policy.

segment.source: It is advisable to set this policy to 15 minutes.
segment.target: It is advisable to set this policy to 15 minutes.

segment.source: There will be little impact because SMB sessions will be reestablished automatically if the client resumes activity.
segment.target: There will be little impact because SMB sessions will be reestablished automatically if the client resumes activity.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: Server type or GPO Default value
segment.target: Server type or GPO Default value

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Each SMB session consumes server resources, and numerous null sessions slow the server or possibly cause it to fail.
segment.target: Each SMB session consumes server resources, and numerous null sessions slow the server or possibly cause it to fail.

segment.source: An attacker could repeatedly establish SMB sessions until the server's SMB services become slow or unresponsive.
segment.target: An attacker could repeatedly establish SMB sessions until the server's SMB services become slow or unresponsive.

segment.source: The default behavior on a server mitigates this threat by design.
segment.target: The default behavior on a server mitigates this threat by design.

segment.source: There is little impact because SMB sessions are reestablished automatically if the client computer resumes activity.
segment.target: There is little impact because SMB sessions are reestablished automatically if the client computer resumes activity.
